meanings.definition: To lower the head or body quickly to avoid a blow or missile.
meanings.sent1: She ducked when the ball came flying towards her head.
meanings.sent2: He ducked just in time to dodge the swinging branch.
meanings.sent3: The cat ducked under the table to escape the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The detective ducked behind the wall to avoid being seen by the suspect.
meanings.sent5: The child ducked under the blanket during the scary movie scene.

meanings.sent1: The duck ducked into the pond for a quick swim.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer ducked under the wave to avoid being hit.
meanings.sent3: The fish ducked under the rock to hide from the predator.
meanings.sent4: The otter ducked into the river with a splash.
meanings.sent5: The seal ducked gracefully into the ocean depths.

meanings.definition: To avoid something by moving quickly out of the way.
meanings.sent1: She ducked around the corner to escape the rain.
meanings.sent2: He ducked out of the path of the speeding bicycle.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel ducked past the barking dog to reach the tree.
meanings.sent4: The student ducked the flying paper airplane in class.
meanings.sent5: The bird ducked away from the swooping hawk.
